title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4201.5 - Fees for services
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4201.5 - Fees for services

State Regulations
(a) It is
the policy of the corporation to provide routine information and to permit
public inspection of records without charge. Fees may be charged in the
following situations: (1)
reproduction, duplication or copying of records; and
(2)
where a fee is otherwise prescribed by
law. (b) Records will be
photocopied by the corporation if practicable. The person requesting a copy
will be charged a fee of 25 cents per page for copies not exceeding 9 by 14
inches, or the actual cost of reproducing such records if larger copies are
required. If it is not practicable for the corporation to photocopy any such
record, it will be copied commercially and the person requesting the copy will
be charged a fee equal to the cost of such commercial reproduction. (c) Any fee charged by the corporation
pursuant to this Part shall be paid by the person making the request, by
certified check or bank cashier's check, or, in the sole discretion of the
corporation, by cash, in advance of the delivery of copies of any record
referred to in this Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
4201.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
